nodes.text: According to one account, a young Human female served as the Emperor's Voice at some point between 3950 BBY and several years before 3640 BBY. As a Voice of the Sith Emperor, her body hosted the Emperor's power and consciousness, being used to issue the Sith Empire leader's commands to his servants. At the time of the Human's death, as with all the Voices before her, her body was abandoned by the Emperor's essence, which left to take a new host.
The Human female was mentioned in the Codex entry for the Voice of the Emperor in Star Wars: The Old Republic, a video game released by BioWare in 2011.
